item.description:
I'm going to be at Bow Lake in Northwood for two weeks in July. I'd love to host a night paddle on Thursday, July 9 beginning around 6:00 p.m. I'm in a great location, plenty of parking, great put in and a grill to BBQ after the paddle. If you've never paddled Bow Lake before and want to join me in July, let me know.

Directions from Route 4 W:
From Spaulding Turnpike, take exit 6W onto Rte. 4W toward Durham/Concord, Stay on Rte. 4 to Lee Traffic Circle, continue on Rte 4 for 14.1 miles, turn right onto BOW LAKE ROAD, go .7 miles, Bow Lake Road curves to the left at a big rock, Simpson Lane is approximately 1.4 miles on the right.

Directions from Route 4 E:
From Epsom Traffic Circle, travel 8.1 miles, turn left onto BOW LAKE ROAD, go .7 miles, Bow Lake Road curves to the left at a big rock, Simpson Lane is approximately 1.4 miles on the right.

Once on Simpson Lane, follow the middle driveway towards a blue camp. If parking gets congested, some cars can park in the clearing at the top of the driveway. I'll have my cell phone if anyone needs to call me - 603-978-1276. Bring food if you want to eat after the paddle. We should be able to paddle for 2-3 hours.


Dorinda Ouellette
item.name: Bow Lake, Northwood, NH
